Room.Name: Before the Tower
Room.Description: You stand before a grand, black tower. The terror rising up inside of your soul is nearly overwhelming as you stare at its obsidian form. The tower walls project an aura of death and evil making you feel quite insignificant. To the north a large mountain has sprouted from the ground to block all hopes of passage. You may go back east to the path, or continue west under an archway. (LOOK CROSS!!!)

Room.Name: Beneath the Archway
Room.Description: The walls of this room disappear above you, completing an arch somewhere in the darkness over your head. Thorn covered vines hang from the walls in thick entanglements; you find yourself getting scratched in the most annoying of places. From the west comes the faint light of torches, and from the north you hear what can only be described as an unholy growl.

Room.Name: The Dracolich's Lair
Room.Description: You find yourself in awe of the treasure and artifacts amassed in this room. One object of truly unusual looks catches your eye. It appears to be a set of gigantic riding equipment, including a large saddle. Just as you are wondering what could possibly fill that saddle, you notice the tremendous form of a dracolich towering above you. The only exit is south, under the archway.

Room.Name: The Entrance Hall
Room.Description: A large carpet covers the floor in this room. The carpet depicts armies of humans and demi-humans being slaughtered by horrible undead hoards. Torches hang on the walls surrounded by old shields and weapons, artifacts from battles long past. Two exits lead from the room, one south and one west. From where you stand it is impossible to see what type of rooms lie beyond.

Room.Name: The Dining Hall
Room.Description: This room looks like what used to be a dining hall. A thick layer of dust lines the table settings, stating that the hall is never used anymore. To the west is the entrance to the kitchen and to your north is the entrance hall.

Room.Name: The Kitchen
Room.Description: You reflexively reach for your nose as the stench of rotting food assaults your senses. You break into a run towards the nearest exit, hoping for fresh air. To the north are the stairs, east is the dining hall, and a large storage room lies open to the south.

Room.Name: The Bottom of the Stairs
Room.Description: A flight of stairs winds away into the darkness above you. A stronger sense of evil comes from up the steps. You can go south to the kitchen, east to the entrance hall, or up into the unknown.

Room.Name: On the Stairs
Room.Description: The steps continue into blackness up or down and there is a small flicker of light entering the room from a doorway east. This whole area seems unnaturally quiet scaring you more than any screams of death you have ever heard.

Room.Name: On the Stairs
Room.Description: You continue your way on the stairs. Listening intently, you think you hear what sounds like the screams of damned and tortured souls to the south and east.

Room.Name: The Top of the Stairs
Room.Description: You have reached the top of the stairs. To the south and east are long hallways and the stairs lead back down into darkness.

Room.Name: Lich's Study
Room.Description: This small room is virtually covered in books and scrolls, each marked in various places with notes. A few oil lamps burn here and there, providing light for the owner of the tower. A large desk sits near the western wall, while a closet has been carved into the wall to the south. The only exit appears to be back into the library to the east.

Room.Name: The Library
Room.Description: Even after seeing the first room of the library, you are still in astonishment of the racks of scrolls that are scattered about this room. Various tables line the walls, providing study space for anyone doing research here. The library continues to the north and a small archway leads west into a study.

Room.Name: The Library
Room.Description: The size of the shelves in this library is astounding. They span the entire length of both the north and east walls. The collection of books accumulated here is amazing. To the south the library continues, while the stairs are back to the west.

Room.Name: A Summoning Room
Room.Description: Various runes and pentagrams have been scrawled into the stone at your feet. A large golden brazier blasts flames in the middle of the room. The only exits are north, to the stairs, and east, to the torture chamber.

Room.Name: The Torture Chamber
Room.Description: Assorted torture devices clutter this room. Against the eastern wall, three rotting bodies hang, each with its guts strewn across the floor. You feel a tinge of remorse for the poor men before your heart rises in anger, now the only thing that matters to you is to avenge their deaths. The summoning rooms provide exit to the north and west.

Room.Name: A Summoning Room
Room.Description: Various runes and pentagrams have been scrawled into the stone at your feet. Towards the middle of the room, a large silver brazier spouts fire. The only exits are west, back to the stairs, and south, to the torture chamber.

Room.Name: A Large Hall
Room.Description: You stand in a large, elaborately decorated hallway. The stairs are back to the north and a large set of double doors are to the east.

Room.Name: The Lich's Throne Room
Room.Description: Entering this room, your eyes lock on a large bone throne and its occupent sitting against the eastern wall. The room is handsomely decorated. Ancient grimoires and scrolls catch your eye for a brief second, just long enough for Myzelak the Lich Lord to attack. The only exits are through the doors to your north or west.

Room.Name: A Large Hall
Room.Description: You stand in a large, elaborately decorated hallway. The stairs are back to the west and a large set of doors block your way south.

Room.Name: A Storage Room
Room.Description: This room appears to be what is left of the kitchen's storage room. An old door has been knocked off of its hinges to the south, revealing an ancient tunnel sloping down into the ground. You can go back north to the kitchen or south into the dark tunnel.

Room.Name: Above a Pit
Room.Description: A large torch hangs against the wall glowing brightly. In front of you the floor disappears, leaving a large hole in the ground. You can go north into the storage room, or down an old rope ladder into the blackness of the pit.

Room.Name: Under a Pit
Room.Description: You stand underneath the pit. In this pitch black room the only thing that you can make out is a tunnel running in a south direction.

Room.Name: A Darkened Tunnel
Room.Description: You stand in an ancient and dark tunnel. From the south light shines into the room. You may go back north to the pit, or, south towards the light.

Room.Name: Before the Caverns
Room.Description: You have found it and it's just as the legends say. This is the entrance to the Caverns of the Damned. A large pit lies hollowed into the ground, magical glyphs and wards surround it, keeping this realm safe from any wandering spirits. It is said that the only way for a mortal to enter the realms of hell is for them to make it through the maze of caverns below you.

Room.Name: Approaching a Dark Tower
Room.Description: The mountain trail winds precariously up the rugged terrain, with loose stones and steep inclines. The air grows colder and heavier as you approach the black tower, a tall and ominous structure that looms in the distance. The closer you get, the stronger the stench of death becomes, making it difficult to breathe. The black walls of the tower are stained with the residue of countless battles, giving it a grim and foreboding appearance. The silence of the mountain is only broken by the sound of the wind whistling through the cracks and crevices of the tower.

Room.Name: Approaching a Dark Tower
Room.Description: The mountain trail winds precariously up the rugged terrain, with loose stones and steep inclines. The air grows colder and heavier as you approach the black tower, a tall and ominous structure that looms in the distance. The closer you get, the stronger the stench of death becomes, making it difficult to breathe. The black walls of the tower are stained with the residue of countless battles, giving it a grim and foreboding appearance. The silence of the mountain is only broken by the sound of the wind whistling through the cracks and crevices of the tower.

Room.Name: Approaching a Dark Tower
Room.Description: The mountain trail winds precariously up the rugged terrain, with loose stones and steep inclines. The air grows colder and heavier as you approach the black tower, a tall and ominous structure that looms in the distance. The closer you get, the stronger the stench of death becomes, making it difficult to breathe. The black walls of the tower are stained with the residue of countless battles, giving it a grim and foreboding appearance. The silence of the mountain is only broken by the sound of the wind whistling through the cracks and crevices of the tower.

Room.Name: Approaching a Dark Tower
Room.Description: The mountain trail winds precariously up the rugged terrain, with loose stones and steep inclines. The air grows colder and heavier as you approach the black tower, a tall and ominous structure that looms in the distance. The closer you get, the stronger the stench of death becomes, making it difficult to breathe. The black walls of the tower are stained with the residue of countless battles, giving it a grim and foreboding appearance. The silence of the mountain is only broken by the sound of the wind whistling through the cracks and crevices of the tower.

Room.Name: Approaching a Dark Tower
Room.Description: The mountain trail winds precariously up the rugged terrain, with loose stones and steep inclines. The air grows colder and heavier as you approach the black tower, a tall and ominous structure that looms in the distance. The closer you get, the stronger the stench of death becomes, making it difficult to breathe. The black walls of the tower are stained with the residue of countless battles, giving it a grim and foreboding appearance. The silence of the mountain is only broken by the sound of the wind whistling through the cracks and crevices of the tower.

NPC.name: Death Knight
NPC.description: Death Knights are a powerful enemy. Turned undead by powerful necromancy, they were the most renown knights of their day.
NPC.longDescription: An undead, skeletal knight guards this room.

NPC.name: torturer inquisitor
NPC.description: This evil creature looks like a zombie but acts much more sinister. It uses its magical abilities to keep its victims alive while it's torturing them.
NPC.longDescription: The Inquisitor is here preparing various torture devices.

NPC.name: demon minor
NPC.description: An aggresive looking demon stands here in the brazier's flames. It appears to have been summoned and is quite angry about it. The long claws and fangs it uses as weapons make you consider running as fast as posible.
NPC.longDescription: A minor demon stands here surrounded in flames.

NPC.name: demon major
NPC.description: A large wicked looking demon floats here in the fire. He has wings, a tail, claws, fangs, he is everything you have pictured a demon would be. His black scaled skin gleams in the firelight The burning flames in his eyes corrupt your soul. Fear him mortal for you are about to die.
NPC.longDescription: A Major Demon floats here in the flames.

NPC.name: lich lord myzelak
NPC.description: Evil incarnate, Myzelak spent years of his life perfecting his magical abilities to grant him life after death. The result of his work stands before you, a rotting representation of what the wizard used to be. Myzelak now spends his time searching for new magics and works, offering what little he has found to any seeking necromancy on some level.
NPC.longDescription: Myzelak the Lich Lord stands here by his throne.
NPC.affectedBy: Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion DetectInvis Flying PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: dracolich mount dragon
NPC.description: Myzelak's Dracolich mount towers above you. Fiery red lights gleam in its hollow eye sockets as it growls at you. The undead dragon is monstrous, perhaps you should run now, before you're dead. ;>

NPC.name: elite death knight
NPC.description: A huge skeletal figure confronts you. He wields an old longsword covered in runes and carries a large black shield that can only be a dragon's scale. He looks very much like the Death Knights you encountered earlier except he is much larger and appears to be more powerful as well.
NPC.longDescription: An Elite Death Knight laughs an unholy cackle and attacks.

Item.Name: black mace
Item.LongDescription: An old, black iron mace lies here undisturbed

Item.Name: glowing skull
Item.LongDescription: A human skull floats here, outlined in blue flames.

Item.Name: wand onyx
Item.LongDescription: A wand carved from onyx is laying here.

Item.Name: rod iron crystals blackwhite black white
Item.ShortDescription: a rod of iron, covered with black and white crystals
Item.LongDescription: A rod of iron sits here, radiating an aura of darkness.

Item.Name: garnet ring
Item.LongDescription: A small garnet ring lies here amongst the treasure.

Item.Name: bracer night
Item.LongDescription: A black bracer covered in ancient runes lies here.

Item.Name: amulet night
Item.LongDescription: An old amulet lies here glowing in unnatural blue light.

Item.Name: ancient longsword sword
Item.LongDescription: An old longsword floats here, glowing slightly.

Item.Name: black scale dragon
Item.LongDescription: A black dragon scale that's been torn from one of the beasts.

Item.Name: hell sword wraith
Item.LongDescription: This sword was supposedly forged in the depths of Hell. It's wavy blade makes it appear much like a large kris. It is a bit unwieldly at first but the damage it inflicts is unbelievable.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum Evil Magic NoRemove Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison

Item.Name: robes sorceror
Item.LongDescription: Illven

Item.Name: infinity scroll
Item.LongDescription: The old scroll rumored to have answers to all questions. (Unfortunately you just killed the last thing in existance that could read it.)

Item.Name: silvery potion
Item.LongDescription: A silvery potion has been left in the desk

Item.Name: key golden
Item.LongDescription: A golden key lies here in the book.

Item.Name: boots water walking waterwalking
Item.LongDescription: Some old leather boots with fish painted on them rest here in the closet.

Item.Name: thieve's tunic
Item.LongDescription: A black shirt with many pockets.

Item.Name: paper blank
Item.LongDescription: A deteriorating piece of blank paper rests here on a shelf.

Item.Name: chair wooden
Item.LongDescription: A large wooden chair sits here at the head of the table

Item.Name: table dining
Item.LongDescription: A huge dining table

Item.Name: old wooden bookshelf shelf
Item.LongDescription: An old wooden bookshelf stands against the eastern wall.
Item.Description: Set against the western wall of the library is a bookcase fashioned of beautifully finished mahogany. Each shelf is filled with a row of neatly arranged, leather-bound books on every conceivable subject. Adjacent to the bookcase, there is a lectern with a single sheet of paper that reads 'index'.

Item.Name: desk mahogany
Item.LongDescription: A large mahogany desk rests against the western wall

Item.Name: closet
Item.ShortDescription: a closet carved into the wall
Item.LongDescription: A large closet, carved into the wall.

Item.Name: grimoire
Item.LongDescription: An ancient and powerful grimoire beckons for you to open it

Item.Name: cross obsidian
Item.LongDescription: A large obsidian cross
